timeline.bodyText: Given the code for SQLTimestamp above, it seems supporting SQLTime is trivial. Any reason to leave it for now?
timeline.author: ascend1

replies.bodyText:
It was not required so far and I am not exactly sure about its semantics since SQLTime is a time period ranging from 00:00:00.0000000 to 23:59:59.9999999 I think we need to map it to a point of time correctly (to act similar to Timestamp), i.e. let's say the current date is 01.01.2020 and given SQLTime is 01:02:03.456789, the resulting Timestamp would be 01.01.2020 01:02:03.456789. I think SQLTime#getTimestamp(Calendar) provides this functionality already.
But to answer your question, I will add support for this data type later since it wasn't required so far IIRC.
replies.author: hatyo
